slides.content:
# Introduction to Human Biology ðŸ«€

Welcome to **Human Biology** - understanding your own body!

## What you'll learn:
- **Organ Systems** - Digestive, circulatory, nervous
- **Anatomy** - Structure of body parts
- **Physiology** - How body parts function
- **Nutrition** - Fuel for the body
- **Health & Disease** - Keeping the body working

> ðŸ’¡ **Fun Fact:** Your body has about 37 trillion cells, and they work together seamlessly!

## Human Body Organization

```
Cells â†’ Tissues â†’ Organs â†’ Organ Systems â†’ Organism
```

## Types of Tissues

| Tissue | Function | Examples |
|--------|----------|----------|
| Epithelial | Cover/line | Skin, intestine lining |
| Connective | Support/connect | Bone, blood, fat |
| Muscle | Movement | Skeletal, cardiac, smooth |
| Nervous | Communication | Neurons, glia |

## Major Organ Systems

| System | Main Function |
|--------|---------------|
| Digestive | Break down food |
| Circulatory | Transport materials |
| Respiratory | Gas exchange |
| Nervous | Control/coordination |
| Skeletal | Support/protection |
| Immune | Defense |

Let's explore the magnificent human machine!

slides.title: Digestive System
slides.content:
# Digestive System ðŸ½ï¸

Breaking down food for absorption.

## The Journey of Food

```
Mouth â†’ Esophagus â†’ Stomach â†’ Small intestine
                                    â†“
               â† Rectum â† Large intestine
```

## Organs and Their Roles

| Organ | Function |
|-------|----------|
| **Mouth** | Mechanical + chemical digestion (amylase) |
| **Esophagus** | Moves food via peristalsis |
| **Stomach** | Churns, adds acid + pepsin |
| **Small intestine** | Most digestion + absorption |
| **Large intestine** | Water absorption |
| **Liver** | Makes bile |
| **Pancreas** | Makes digestive enzymes |
| **Gallbladder** | Stores bile |

## Types of Digestion

### Mechanical
- Chewing (mouth)
- Churning (stomach)
- Segmentation (intestines)

### Chemical (Enzymes)

| Enzyme | Substrate | Product |
|--------|-----------|--------|
| Amylase | Starch | Sugars |
| Protease | Proteins | Amino acids |
| Lipase | Fats | Fatty acids + glycerol |

## Absorption

**Small Intestine:**
- Surface area increased by villi and microvilli
- Nutrients â†’ Blood â†’ Cells

## Digestive Problems

| Condition | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Heartburn | Acid reflux |
| Ulcers | Stomach lining damage |
| Celiac | Gluten intolerance |
| IBS | Irritable bowel syndrome |

> ðŸŽ¯ **Key Point:** The small intestine is where most absorption happens!

slides.content:
# Circulatory System â¤ï¸

Transporting materials around the body.

## Components

### The Heart
- 4 chambers (2 atria, 2 ventricles)
- Two pumps in one
- Beats ~100,000 times/day

```
     Right Atrium    Left Atrium
          â–¼               â–¼
    Right Ventricle  Left Ventricle
          â†“               â†“
       Lungs (Oâ‚‚)     Body (Oâ‚‚ delivery)
```

### Blood Vessels

| Type | Function | Characteristics |
|------|----------|----------------|
| Arteries | Carry blood AWAY | Thick walls, high pressure |
| Veins | Carry blood TOWARD | Valves, low pressure |
| Capillaries | Exchange | Thin walls, tiny |

### Blood

| Component | Function |
|-----------|----------|
| Red blood cells | Carry Oâ‚‚ (hemoglobin) |
| White blood cells | Immune defense |
| Platelets | Clotting |
| Plasma | Liquid transport |

## Two Circuits

### Pulmonary (Heart â†” Lungs)
- Right ventricle â†’ Lungs â†’ Left atrium
- Picks up Oâ‚‚, drops off COâ‚‚

### Systemic (Heart â†” Body)
- Left ventricle â†’ Body â†’ Right atrium
- Delivers Oâ‚‚, picks up COâ‚‚

## Heart Disease

- Atherosclerosis (blocked arteries)
- Heart attack
- High blood pressure

> ðŸ’¡ **Stat:** Blood travels 100,000 km of blood vessels in your body!

## Pathway of Air

         Bronchioles â† Bronchi

## Anatomy

|-----------|----------|
| Nasal cavity | Warm, moisten, filter |
| Pharynx | Throat (shared pathway) |
| Larynx | Voice box |
| Trachea | Windpipe (C-shaped cartilage) |
| Bronchi | Airways to each lung |
| Bronchioles | Small airways |
| Alveoli | Gas exchange (300 million!) |

## Breathing Mechanics

### Inhalation
- Diaphragm contracts (moves down)
- Rib cage expands
- Pressure decreases â†’ Air rushes in

### Exhalation
- Diaphragm relaxes (moves up)
- Rib cage contracts
- Pressure increases â†’ Air pushed out

## Respiratory Disorders

| Condition | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Asthma | Airways constrict |
| Bronchitis | Inflamed bronchi |
| Emphysema | Damaged alveoli |
| Pneumonia | Lung infection |

slides.title: Immune System
slides.content:
# Immune System ðŸ›¡ï¸

Defending against pathogens.

## Three Lines of Defense

### 1st Line: Physical Barriers
- Skin (waterproof, acidic)
- Mucus (traps pathogens)
- Cilia (sweep out particles)
- Stomach acid

### 2nd Line: Nonspecific (Innate)
- Inflammation
- Fever
- Phagocytes (eat pathogens)
- Natural killer cells

### 3rd Line: Specific (Adaptive)
- Lymphocytes (B and T cells)
- Antibodies
- Memory cells

## Key Cells

| Cell | Function |
|------|----------|
| Macrophages | Phagocytosis, present antigens |
| B cells | Make antibodies |
| T helper cells | Coordinate immune response |
| T killer cells | Destroy infected cells |
| Memory cells | Remember pathogens |

## Antibodies

```
    â”€â”€Yâ”€â”€
    Antigen-binding sites
    (Each antibody specific to one antigen)
```

## Vaccination

```
Weakened/killed pathogen â†’ Immune response â†’ Memory cells

Future exposure â†’ Fast response â†’ No disease
```

## Immune Disorders

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Allergies | Overreaction to harmless substances |
| Autoimmune | Attack own cells (lupus, MS) |
| Immunodeficiency | Weak immune system (AIDS) |

> ðŸŽ¯ **Key Point:** Vaccines train your immune system without causing disease!

slides.title: Nutrition
slides.content:
# Nutrition ðŸ¥—

What your body needs from food.

## Macronutrients (Large amounts needed)

| Nutrient | Function | Sources |
|----------|----------|--------|
| Carbohydrates | Energy (4 kcal/g) | Bread, pasta, fruits |
| Proteins | Building blocks (4 kcal/g) | Meat, beans, eggs |
| Fats | Energy storage (9 kcal/g) | Oils, nuts, dairy |

## Micronutrients (Small amounts needed)

### Vitamins

| Vitamin | Function | Deficiency |
|---------|----------|------------|
| A | Vision | Night blindness |
| C | Immune, collagen | Scurvy |
| D | Calcium absorption | Rickets |
| B12 | Red blood cells | Anemia |

### Minerals

| Mineral | Function | Deficiency |
|---------|----------|------------|
| Iron | Hemoglobin | Anemia |
| Calcium | Bones, muscles | Osteoporosis |
| Iodine | Thyroid | Goiter |
| Zinc | Immune function | Poor healing |

## Water

- 60% of body weight
- Need ~2 L/day
- Essential for all reactions

slides.title: Health and Disease
slides.content:
# Health and Disease ðŸ¥

## Types of Disease

### Infectious (Communicable)

Caused by pathogens, can spread.

| Pathogen | Example Disease |
|----------|----------------|
| Bacteria | Tuberculosis, cholera |
| Virus | Flu, COVID-19, AIDS |
| Fungi | Athlete's foot |
| Protist | Malaria |
| Prion | Mad cow disease |

### Non-Infectious

Not caused by pathogens, cannot spread.

| Type | Examples |
|------|----------|
| Genetic | Sickle cell, cystic fibrosis |
| Nutritional | Scurvy, rickets |
| Degenerative | Alzheimer's, arthritis |
| Cancer | Various |

## Disease Transmission

| Route | Examples |
|-------|----------|
| Airborne | Flu, TB |
| Contact | Skin infections |
| Vector | Malaria (mosquito) |
| Waterborne | Cholera |
| Food | Salmonella |

## Prevention

- Vaccination
- Hand washing
- Safe food handling
- Clean water
- Vector control

## Lifestyle Diseases

| Disease | Risk Factors |
|---------|-------------|
| Heart disease | Smoking, diet, inactivity |
| Type 2 diabetes | Obesity, diet |
| Lung cancer | Smoking |
| Liver disease | Alcohol |

## Public Health

- Sanitation
- Health education
- Disease surveillance
- Emergency response

> ðŸŽ¯ **Key Point:** Many diseases are preventable through lifestyle choices!
